p: The antifungal effects depended on the type and concentration of EO, and on the pathogen species [ 17]. M. fructicola was almost completely inhibited by savory vapors at 10%. Thyme essential oil vapors led to 40% decrease of conidial germination rate. As expected, vapor treatments were more effective in vitro, when EO concentration increased. All the EO treatments caused a significant decrease of germ tube length with respect to the untreated control ( Table 4).
